title: How well does the reworked Ashe scale mid and late game?
body:
The new reworked Ashe is meant to be part support, but ADCs and Supports are practically the opposite

ADC:
Damage
Late Game Scaling
Need a lot of gold

Support:
CC
Falls of late game
Needs little gold

How well does Ashe do as an ADC or support now? Is she the opposite of hyper carries like Vayne and Tristana, peaking in power at the end of middle game rather than far into late game?

replies.body:
wtf are you talking about? crit makes ashe amazing now. read her passive again...
and she is one of the hardest scaling adcs in the game like she always has been. shes a hyper carry not a support lol

For those who don't understand how this game works, yes she is a hyper carry, for those who can understand why ADC's work, they will know better.

>110 + (%Critical Strike Chance × (1 + Bonus Critical Strike Damage)) %AD

This is Ashe's Passive damage, now other then an IE basically any form of Critical strike is out classed by Flat AD, as her passive doesn't actually make her scale well with Critical strike chance, as she always critical strikes.

Passive with IE: 110+(20% X 1.5) = 140% Crit damage (EG your crit and hit for 40% more of your AD)
Passive with IE and PD: 110+(55% X 1.5) = 192.5% Crit damage

Now sure that PD increased her Crit's by 52%, but the downside is that a normal ADC with 55% crit chance has the ability to crit for 250% of their AD every second Auto, whereas you only do 192.5% every auto, meaning that AD getting lucky actually screws you.

And because most Critical strike items DON'T come with AD past IE (or at least ones that scale decently on Ashe) your better off just getting flat AD items instead of focusing on your Criticals because there is no point.

And since they removed her bonus damage on towers she has actually fallen hard as an ADC because she has very little to offer at this moment in time that other ADC's don't offer, and other ADC's Crit's actually scale decently or can scale off items harder then she can.

(EDIT: God damn boards and using * as an indicator for shit.)
